gurmukhi: ਰਕਤ ਬੀਜ ਤਬ ਭੂਪ ਬੁਲਾਯੋ ॥ ਅਮਿਤ ਦਰਬੁ ਦੈ ਤਹਾਂ ਪਠਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Rakat Booj Tab Bhoop Bulaayo|| Amit Darab(u) Dai Tahaan Pathaayo||
translation: Then the king called Rakat Beej and sent him after giving him enormous wealth.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਬਿਧਿ ਦੲੀ ਬਿਰੂਥਨ ਸੰਗਾ ॥ ਹੈ ਗੈ ਰਥ ਪੈਦਲ ਚਤੁਰੰਗਾ ॥੨॥੭੯॥
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Daoo Biroothan Satgad|| Hai Gad Rath Paidal Chaturanad||2||79||
translation: He was also given various types of forces, which was fourfold: on horses, on elephants, on chariots and on foot.2.79.

gurmukhi: ਰਕਤ ਬੀਜ ਦੈ ਚਲਯੋ ਨਗਾਰਾ ॥ ਦੇਵ ਲੋਗ ਲੳੁ ਸੁਨੀ ਪੁਕਾਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Rokat Booj Dai Chadyo Nagadraa|| Dev Log Lau Sounoo Poukaaraa||
translation: Rakat Beej marched after sounding his trumpet, which was heard even in the habitation of gods.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਪੀ ਭੂਮ ਗਗਨ ਥਹਰਾਨਾ ॥ ਦੇਵਨ ਜੁਤਿ ਦਿਵਰਾਜ ਡਰਾਨਾ ॥੩॥੮੦॥
transliteration: Kanpoo Bhoom Gadan Thahraanaa|| Devaj Jout(i) Divrj Daraanaa||3||80||
translation: The earth ttrembled and the sky vibrated, all the godds including the king were filled with fear.3.80.

gurmukhi: ਧਵਲਾ ਗਿਰ ਕੇ ਜਬ ਤਟ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਦੁੰਦਭ ਢੋਲ ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਬਜਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Dhavlaa Gir Ke Jab Tat Aae|| Doundabh Dhol Mridan Bajaae||
translation: When they came near the Kailash mountain, they sounded trumpets, drums and tabours.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਹੀ ਸੂਨਾ ਕੁਲਾਹਲ ਕਾਨਾ ॥ ੳੁਤਰੀ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਲੈ ਨਾਨਾ ॥੪॥੮੧॥
transliteration: Jab Hoo Sounaa Kulaahal Kaanaa|| Outroo Sastra Astra Lai Naanaa||4||81||
translation: When the gods heard the noises with their ears, the goddess Durga descended the mountain, taking many weapons and arms.4.81.

gurmukhi: ਛਹਬਰ ਲਾੲਿ ਬਰਖੀਯੰ ਬਾਣੰ ॥ ਬਾਜ ਰਾਜ ਅਰੁ ਗਿਰੇ ਕਿਕਾਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Chhahbar Laae Barkhooyan Baanan|| Baaj Raaj Ar(u) Gire Kikaanan||
translation: The goddess showered arrows like incessant rain, which caused the horses and their riders fall down.

gurmukhi: ਢਹਿ ਢਹਿ ਪਰੇ ਸੁਭਟ ਸਿਰਦਾਰਾ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਕਰ ਕਟੇ ਬਿਰਛ ਸੰਗ ਅਾਰਾ ॥੫॥੮੨॥
transliteration: Dhah(i) Dhah(i) Dare Soubhat Sirdaaraa|| Jan(u) Kar Kate Birch San Aaraa||5||82||
translation: Many warriors and their chieftainsfell, it seemed as if the trees had been sawed.5.82.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਜੇ ਸਤ੍ਰੁ ਸਾਮੁਹੇ ਭੲੇ ॥ ਬਹੁਰ ਜੀਅਤ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਗੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Je Je Satr(u) Saamuje Bhae|| Bahur Jooat Grih Ko Nahoo Gad||
translation: Those enemies ho came in front of her, they could not again return to their homes alive.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਹ ਪਰ ਪਰਤ ਭੲੀ ਤਰਵਾਰਾ ॥ ੲਿਕ ੲਿਕ ਤੇਂ ਭੲੇ ਦੋ ਦੋ ਚਾਰਾ ॥੬॥੮੩॥
transliteration: Jih Par Parat Bhaoo Tarvaaraa|| Ik Ik Ten Bhae Do Do Chaaraa||6||83||
translation: Those who were struck by the sword, they fell down in two halves or four quarters.6.83.

gurmukhi: ਝਿਮੀ ਤੇਜ ਤੇਗੰ ਸੁ ਰੋਸੰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰੰ ॥
translation: The sword which she has struck in ire;
It hath hlistened like lightning in the month of Bhadon.
